channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: 10 months' jail for trio who assaulted policeman at St James Power Station
item.description:
June 03, 2020 8:06 PM

SINGAPORE - The trio who assaulted a plainclothes policeman on duty at a St James Power Station club in 2017 were each sentenced to 10 months' jail on Wednesday (June 3).

item.title: Approved travellers on new Singapore-China 'fast lane' need not serve quarantine but must do Covid-19 swab tests
item.description:
June 03, 2020 7:18 PM

For a start, the scheme will apply only for business and official travel, for flights between Singapore and six provinces in China.

item.title: Nature's tweets: Listen to songs of native birds as Singapore hums back to life
item.description:
June 03, 2020 7:00 PM

SINGAPORE - The circuit breaker period has ended, and the city is slowly humming back to life.

item.title: 9 students fined over unlawful gathering in apartment, man faces charges linked to Covid-19 outbreak
item.description:
June 03, 2020 6:54 PM

SINGAPORE - Nine students from India were fined on Wednesday (June 3) for unlawfully gathering in an apartment on May 5, while circuit breaker measures were still in effect.

item.title: Evening Update: Today's headlines from The Straits Times on June 3
item.description:
June 03, 2020 6:48 PM

Good evening! Catch up on some of the main headlines on Wednesday, June 3.

item.title: Bedok Police Division nabs best land division award in virtual Police Day ceremony
item.description:
June 03, 2020 6:41 PM

SINGAPORE - From arresting a mother who abandoned her baby in a rubbish chute, to nabbing a suspect who drove against traffic to evade capture, police officers at the Bedok Police Division have solved several high profile cases in the past year.

item.title: Severe penalties for abuse of Jobs Support Scheme to get higher payouts: Iras
item.description:
June 03, 2020 6:16 PM

SINGAPORE - The taxman has warned employers who abuse the Jobs Support Scheme (JSS) to obtain higher payouts that they could be charged under the Penal Code and face up to 10 years' imprisonment and a fine.

item.title: National Jobs Council will create jobs and training opportunities on an unprecedented scale: Tharman
item.description:
June 03, 2020 6:15 PM

The high-level council will oversee the design and implementation of the SGUnited Jobs and Skills Package announced in the Fortitude Budget speech last month.

item.title: Health Check Podcast: Stress fractures from running too much during Covid-19 pandemic?
Former managing director jailed for crowdfunding for SMEs without licence
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:41 PM

SINGAPORE - A former managing director of a company is the first person to be sent to jail for using crowdfunding to secure monies for small- and medium-sized enterprises despite not having a licence to do so.

item.title: Dentist first to be jailed for submitting false Community Health Assist Scheme claims
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:28 PM

SINGAPORE - A 36-year-old dentist on Wednesday (June 3) became the first person to be jailed for cheating the Government through the Community Health Assist Scheme (Chas).

item.title: Huge dengue outbreak expected this year; more than 9,000 infected and 12 dead so far
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:09 PM

There are now 164 active dengue clusters, the biggest at Woodleigh, with 175 people infected.

item.title: More than 5,400 home renovation projects approved by BCA to resume works
item.description:
June 03, 2020 4:53 PM

All new applications to resume works will be approved within two days, provided the submission is in order.

item.title: Trans-Cab fleet almost halved since arrival of private-hire firms
item.description:
June 03, 2020 4:37 PM

SINGAPORE - Trans-Cab, the second largest taxi operator here, bore the brunt of a fleet shrinkage brought about by the arrival of private-hire operators.

item.title: Sex worker who allowed man into home among 5 people sentenced over Covid-19 related offences
item.description:
June 03, 2020 4:22 PM

SINGAPORE - A sex worker breached safe distancing measures and allowed a regular customer to enter her home during the circuit breaker period.

item.title: Government agency received 300 calls a day during circuit breaker period for eldercare assistance
item.description:
June 03, 2020 4:16 PM

Besides inquiries on eldercare-related financial aid schemes, callers have asked for meals to be delivered to the elderly.

item.title: 569 new coronavirus cases in Singapore, including 7 community cases
item.description:
June 03, 2020 3:10 PM

Of the community cases, one is a Singaporean or permanent resident, while six are work pass holders.

item.title: Former HR manager in Hyflux subsidiary charged with corruption
item.description:
June 03, 2020 2:24 PM

Khoo Chen Ee, 36, who was with Hydrochem (S), is accused of receiving or agreeing to receive about $7,000 in "rewards" on three occasions.

item.title: 2 Singaporean men, 3 foreign women arrested for alleged drug and duty-unpaid cigarette activities
item.description:
June 03, 2020 2:10 PM

SINGAPORE - The authorities, acting on a tip-off, have arrested two Singaporean men and three foreign women for alleged drug and duty-unpaid cigarette activities.

item.title: 80 breaches found at purpose-built dorms annually for the past 3 years: MOM
item.description:
June 03, 2020 2:03 PM

Minor lapses, which account for about 60 per cent of the total breaches, include failing to maintain tidiness and cleanliness in one area of the dormitory.

item.title: Power supply reinstated at more than 4,000 unused sites designated for quarantine and other Covid-19 purposes
item.description:
June 03, 2020 12:54 PM

These premises include former dormitories, factories that are no longer in operation and Housing Board flats that had been vacated.

item.title: Veteran track and field coach Loh Chan Pew found guilty of molesting teenage athlete
item.description:
June 03, 2020 12:47 PM

For his offences, he can be jailed for up to two years and/or fined.

item.title: Appointments to Council of Presidential Advisers made
item.description:
June 03, 2020 12:00 PM

President Halimah Yacob has appointed a member and an alternate member to the Council of Presidential Advisers (CPA).

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on June 3
Probation for youth who took upskirt videos
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

A Republic Polytechnic (RP) student who used his mobile phone to record upskirt videos of multiple women at different places - including his school - was sentenced yesterday to 18 months' probation.

item.title: 7 charged with breaching circuit breaker rules in Robertson Quay
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Six men and a woman, allegedly linked to a group gathering in the Robertson Quay area amid the pandemic, appeared in a district court yesterday.

item.title: Low-income families to get more integrated support
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

An initiative to proactively reach out to 50,000 low-income families living in rental flats will begin this month, to ensure no one falls through the cracks during the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Youth pleads guilty to abusing maid
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

A youth not only spat on his family's domestic helper and threw a metal mug at her face, which left her with injuries, but also told her that she was "only a maid, was poor and had no right to be in Singapore".

item.title: Comfort cabbies can now deliver meds amid demand surge
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Public healthcare institutions can now tap ComfortDelGro taxi drivers to deliver medicine to patients with pre-existing conditions who require regular top-ups, amid a surge in demand for medication delivery since January.

item.title: 10 must-reads for today
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Just when Mr Victor Hoon had put his delinquent ways behind him, he had to work hard once again after a motorcycle accident left him paralysed from the neck down.

item.title: 21-year-old pleads guilty to loan-shark harassment
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

A full-time national serviceman (NSF) who left his home to commit loan-shark harassment during the circuit breaker period pleaded guilty to breaching safe distancing measures yesterday.

item.title: Grab to stop passengers from using front seat
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Commuters looking to book trips with ride-hailing firm Grab will soon be stopped from sitting in the front seat of the vehicle alongside the driver.

item.title: Streets and schools come alive again as Singapore reopens
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Around 75 per cent of the economy is expected to resume operations in phase one.

item.title: Let's focus on overcoming virus, says Lawrence Wong
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore was once touted as having achieved the gold stan-dard in tackling Covid-19. But the subsequent surge in imported cases and virus spread in foreign worker dormitories led to nega-tive international media coverage on its approach.

item.title: Singapore to implement ICAO guidelines fully
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore will fully implement the Covid-19 guidelines proposed by the International Civil Aviation Organisation (ICAO) as flights gradually resume worldwide.

item.title: Returning pre-schoolers receive warm welcome
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

St James' Church Kindergarten yesterday ushered the oldest group of children from its Harding Road campus in Dempsey into a new season, or "spring break", as the pre-school called it.

item.title: Phased reopening to protect lives, livelihoods: Minister
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

A phased approach to reopening Singapore will help protect both lives and livelihoods, but Singaporeans must get used to the "new normal" of living with restrictions, said National Development Minister Lawrence Wong.

item.title: Row over running of Pine Grove condo ends
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

A six-month impasse over who should run the Pine Grove condominium has ended with the outgoing management council (MC) handing over to the group elected last November.

item.title: Pupils begin adapting to new normal of safe distancing
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Changes include wearing facial masks throughout the day, not talking to friends without their masks on and walking in single file at least 1m apart.

item.title: Now is a good time to reopen schools, says Ong Ye Kung
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Considering it could be a year or more before a vaccine for Covid-19 is found and since there are few new cases of infection in the community, now is a good time to reopen schools, Education Minister Ong Ye Kung said yesterday.

item.title: As economy reopens, it's back to work - and the pet groomers
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Roads, trains and buses were more crowded yesterday morning as students returned to school and more people went back to work on the first day after the end of the circuit breaker.

item.title: End of the road for car-sharing firm Smove
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Car-sharing firm Smove is under liquidation - the first major player in the vehicle rental market to go bust in recent years.

item.title: New life as mouth painter after accident
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

The last thing Mr Victor Hoon remembers of his accident in 2005 is speeding up around a bend on his motorcycle while on his way to a friend's home.

item.title: ST wins global award for campaign tailoring news on virus for students
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

The Straits Times has won a global media award for a campaign which tailored Covid-19 pandemic news for schoolchildren.

item.title: Car rentals reeling from Covid-19 impact
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Fuelled by private-hire demand, Singapore's rental car population had been growing exponentially since 2014. But the coronavirus put the brakes on that trend.

item.title: 80-year-old Singaporean woman among four new community cases
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

An 80-year-old Singaporean woman is among four new Covid-19 cases in the community that were announced yesterday.

item.title: Citi announces 3 initiatives to help community Covid-19 relief efforts
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

To support Covid-19 community relief efforts in Singapore, Citi announced yesterday three initiatives, including pledging $150,000 to The Straits Times School Pocket Money Fund and The Business Times Budding Artists Fund.

item.title: Most residents understand why workers moved to estates: MPs
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

At the former Serangoon Junior College campus, work has already started to turn the building from a school into a temporary home for migrant workers.

item.title: askST: Do I still need to wear a mask in the office? What if my mask becomes discoloured?
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Will a discoloured reusable mask lose its effectiveness?

item.title: Emotional reunion for some families after close to 60 days of separation
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

With the lifting of some circuit breaker measures, many people turned up at their parents' and grandparents' doors yesterday.

item.title: TOC case: Man loses 3rd bid to mount constitutional challenge
item.description:
June 03, 2020 5:00 AM

A man accused of defaming members of the Cabinet in an article published on socio-political website The Online Citizen (TOC) has lost his latest bid to mount a constitutional challenge against his criminal charges.

item.title: How climate change affects Singapore
item.description:
June 03, 2020 4:00 AM

Many might think that climate change is insignificant because we contribute just 0.11 per cent to global emissions. However, experts emphasise that everyone plays a part in resolving the crisis of climate change. Here, The Straits Times’ climate change editor David Fogarty and environment correspondent Audrey Tan explain the direct impact of climate change on Singapore.
